article_metadata.description: A state Senate race in Jackson County that could shift the balance of power in Salem is being watched closely by politicos in the northern part of the state.Sen. Alan Bates, D-Medford, is running in what could turn into a very expensive race against Dave Dotterrer, R-Ashland, who lost by only 282 votes in the 2010 election.Both candidates have viewed polls that show there is no clear winner for the Nov. 4 election. Also, a late entry by Pacific Green Party candidate Art Krueger could siphon
article_metadata.author: Damian Mann Mail Tribune
